reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 158/20: LIMITING WORK TO A SINGLE RETIREMENT HOME

content.content: 1. The terms of this Order are set out in Schedule 1. O. Reg. 398/20, s. 3. Schedule 1   Limiting Work to a Single Retirement Home
content.raw_html:
1. The terms of this Order are set out in Schedule 1. O. Reg. 398/20, s. 3.

Schedule 1
Limiting Work to a Single Retirement Home

content.content: 1. (1) In this Order, “health service provider” has the same meaning as in subsection 1 (2) of the Connecting Care Act, 2019, subject to section 2; (“fournisseur de services de santé”) “licensee” has the same meaning as in subsection 2 (1) of the Retirement Homes Act, 2010; (“titulaire de permis”) “long-term care home” has the same meaning as in subsection 2 (1) of the Long-Term Care Homes Act, 2007; (“foyer de soins de longue durée”) “medical officer of health” means a medical officer of health as defined in the Health Protection and Promotion Act; (“médecin-hygiéniste”) “retirement home” means a retirement home within the meaning of the Retirement Homes Act, 2010. (“maison de retraite”) (2) For the purposes of this Order, a person is fully vaccinated against COVID-19 if the person is fully vaccinated as described in section 2.1 of Schedule 1 to Ontario Regulation 364/20 (Rules for Areas at Step 3 and at the Roadmap Exit Step) made under the Act.
content.raw_html:
1. (1) In this Order,

“health service provider” has the same meaning as in subsection 1 (2) of the Connecting Care Act, 2019, subject to section 2; (“fournisseur de services de santé”)

“licensee” has the same meaning as in subsection 2 (1) of the Retirement Homes Act, 2010; (“titulaire de permis”)

“long-term care home” has the same meaning as in subsection 2 (1) of the Long-Term Care Homes Act, 2007; (“foyer de soins de longue durée”)

“medical officer of health” means a medical officer of health as defined in the Health Protection and Promotion Act; (“médecin-hygiéniste”)

“retirement home” means a retirement home within the meaning of the Retirement Homes Act, 2010. (“maison de retraite”)

(2) For the purposes of this Order, a person is fully vaccinated against COVID-19 if the person is fully vaccinated as described in section 2.1 of Schedule 1 to Ontario Regulation 364/20 (Rules for Areas at Step 3 and at the Roadmap Exit Step) made under the Act.

content.content: 2. This Order applies to a health service provider within the meaning of paragraph 5 of subsection 1 (2) of the Connecting Care Act, 2019 only in relation to long-term care homes the health service provider maintains.
content.raw_html: 2. This Order applies to a health service provider within the meaning of paragraph 5 of subsection 1 (2) of the Connecting Care Act, 2019 only in relation to long-term care homes the health service provider maintains.

content.content: 3. (1) An employee of a licensee who performs work in a retirement home shall not also perform work, (a)  in another retirement home operated by the licensee; (b)  as an employee of another licensee; or (c)  as an employee of a health service provider. (2) Subsection (1) does not apply with respect to an employee who is fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless otherwise directed by a medical officer of health.
content.raw_html:
3. (1) An employee of a licensee who performs work in a retirement home shall not also perform work,

(a)  in another retirement home operated by the licensee;

(b)  as an employee of another licensee; or

(c)  as an employee of a health service provider.

(2) Subsection (1) does not apply with respect to an employee who is fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless otherwise directed by a medical officer of health.

content.content: 4. For greater certainty, (a)  subsection 7.0.2 (6) of the Emergency Management and Civil Protection Act applies with respect to an employee to whom this Order applies; and (b)  an employee to whom this Order applies shall comply with section 3 even if doing so would not be in compliance with the provisions of a collective agreement.
content.raw_html:
4. For greater certainty,

(a)  subsection 7.0.2 (6) of the Emergency Management and Civil Protection Act applies with respect to an employee to whom this Order applies; and

(b)  an employee to whom this Order applies shall comply with section 3 even if doing so would not be in compliance with the provisions of a collective agreement.

content.content: 5. (1) A licensee shall ensure that any employee in a retirement home it operates is not also performing work, (a)  in another retirement home, including another retirement home operated by the licensee; or (b)  as an employee of a health service provider. (2) Subsection (1) does not apply with respect to an employee who is fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless otherwise directed by a medical officer of health.
content.raw_html:
5. (1) A licensee shall ensure that any employee in a retirement home it operates is not also performing work,

(a)  in another retirement home, including another retirement home operated by the licensee; or

(b)  as an employee of a health service provider.

(2) Subsection (1) does not apply with respect to an employee who is fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless otherwise directed by a medical officer of health.

content.content: 6. A licensee shall ensure that a copy of this Order is posted in each retirement home that the licensee operates in a conspicuous and easily accessible location in a manner that complies with the regulations made under the Retirement Homes Act, 2010.
content.raw_html: 6. A licensee shall ensure that a copy of this Order is posted in each retirement home that the licensee operates in a conspicuous and easily accessible location in a manner that complies with the regulations made under the Retirement Homes Act, 2010.

content.content: 7. In the event of a conflict between this Order and Ontario Regulation 118/20 (Work Deployment Measures in Retirement Homes), this Order prevails. O. Reg. 318/21, s. 1; O. Reg. 579/21, s. 1; O. Reg. 661/21, s. 1.  Français
content.raw_html:
7. In the event of a conflict between this Order and Ontario Regulation 118/20 (Work Deployment Measures in Retirement Homes), this Order prevails.

O. Reg. 318/21, s. 1; O. Reg. 579/21, s. 1; O. Reg. 661/21, s. 1.
